source.ff90a37d:
### Observation:
* Data scientist mostly prefered to have Master's, Bachelor's, & Doctoral Degree.
* Data Analyst mostly have Master's and Bachelor's Degree.
source.d079af02:
## Observations:

* Mostly prefered is Master's Degree among all as "The highest level of formal education."
* Bachelor's and Doctrate are also popular formal eduaction among both gender.
* Males are more into the formal degree, majority of males prefer Masters as compared to females
source.db6f5087:
### Observation:
* Males clearly dominant Females in terms of Data Scientist and Analyst role.
* Mostly males go for Data Scientist job role.
source.09426357:
AS we can  observe mostly younger age group are highly enthuastic towards the data scientist job title.  they are highly dominating over the other role i.e. data analyst.The youth basicallly b/w the age 25-29 are highly growing fastly, which is followed by the age group of 22+ to 39 is highly influenced by data scientist job title.

Data Analyst is also mostly adaptive among the youth age group b/w 22-34 are mostly tilting towards it.
source.4331f760:
### observations:

* US leads with maximum number of data scientist and analyst in global market followed by India.
* India and US are focusing more on these advace technology then any any other country in the world with majority or people moving towards it.
* as it can be noticed Data Scientist is more in demand and growing a lot.
source.39052901:
As we look into gender wise review data b/w male and female mostly male dominance can be easily noticed, male shows high dominance on female in terms of Data Scientist or Data Analyst role. Male are mostly attracted toward these kinds of job role as they found it more intresting to explore.

Females only b/w the age group of 25-29 can be observed in working as a job role for Data Scientist or Data Analyst.
source.1a5d9b04: # Title most similar to current role based on gender
source.ccd02b18: # Introduction Welcome to a Story from the 2018 Kaggle Machine Learning and Data Science Survey.In this Kernel I will provide a broad and comprehensive narrated exploration and visualisation of the survey results that will be anchored around the detailed analysis of the topics of (i) country-wise demographics, (ii) self-assessment of data science skills, (iii) age groups, (iv) the role of reproducibility, and (v) gender group in Data Science and Machine Learning. These five key aspects will be the consistent threads that run through this Kernel. They will be examined in the context of the various survey questions which will provide the rich background to understand this most recent profiles of a unique community. I will explore the survey in its entire breadth and touch on many properties that deserve further examination. Time and time again, the analysis will come back to the key threads and view them in the light of new findings. According to the data description the **“survey received 23,859 usable respondents from 147 countries and territories”.** This makes it a highly valuable and unique source for exploring the state of Data Science in 2018.
